ygData.subject: RE: Secret Code (OOC)
ygData.msgSnippet: I am talking about items for sale.   And it may be easy for you to find out but not everyone that reads these lists are as computer literate as some of us.  It
ygData.messageBody:
I am talking about items for sale. And it may be easy for you to find out
but not everyone that reads these lists are as computer literate as some of
us. It is not that much more difficult to type out the word when posting to
the mailing list. I tend to agree with Bob though - acronyms are a bad
slang. Almost as bad as DewdSpeak (ie. 'Sup?' 'U' 'Ur' 'Ne1')


> ----------
> From: Jesse[SMTP:j@...]
> Reply To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Sent: Friday, July 23, 1999 10:14 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Secret Code (OOC)
>
> From: Jesse <j@...>
>
>
> > Just for an example, I have LBA, LG, and DBBA for sell. Do you know
> what I
> > am talking about? No - go to this page and look it up then :)
>
> If we were talking about whatever field/subject that those acronyms were
> appropriate for, I would expect everyone participating to know them and
> all the basic lingo of the subject/field. If they didn't know, easy enough
> to find out.
>
> ---
> Jesse <j@...>
> http://www.lumiere.net/
>
